hawaiian_text: O Kalelealuaka a me Keinohoomanawanui, i ko laua ala ana i ke kakahiaka a hele iwaho o ka hale, iko iho la laua he pahoa e ku ana ma ka puka o ka hale, ua kukuluia. I aku o Keinohoomanawanui ia Kalelealuaka: “Make kaua! Eia la he pahoa ma ka puka o ka hale o kaua! Ua loaa. Aloha ino kaua i ka make; o ka’u no ia e olelo aku ana ia oe e waiho ke ’lii, aohe make olelo.”
reference_translation: When Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui woke up in the morning and went out of doors, they saw a wooden dagger sticking in the ground just outside of the entrance. At seeing this Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: “We are going to be killed. Here is a wooden dagger at our door. We have been discovered. What a pity that we are to be killed. You can now see the consequences of disobeying my advice, not to speak anything in connection with the king.”
llama4-maverick-fireworks_translation:
To translate the given Hawaiian text into English, let's break it down and analyze it step by step.

1. **"O Kalelealuaka a me Keinohoomanawanui, i ko laua ala ana i ke kakahiaka a hele iwaho o ka hale"** translates to "Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui, when they arose in the morning and went out of the house".

2. **"iko iho la laua he pahoa e ku ana ma ka puka o ka hale, ua kukuluia"** translates to "they saw a spear standing at the door of the house, it was erected/standing there".

3. **"I aku o Keinohoomanawanui ia Kalelealuaka: 'Make kaua!'"** translates to "Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: 'We are doomed!' or 'We're going to die!'".

4. **"'Eia la he pahoa ma ka puka o ka hale o kaua! Ua loaa'"** translates to "'Here is a spear at the door of our house! It is found/obtained'".

5. **"'Aloha ino kaua i ka make; o ka’u no ia e olelo aku ana ia oe e waiho ke ’lii, aohe make olelo'"** translates to "'We are unlucky in death; I was just about to tell you to leave the chief, there is no exemption from death'".

Putting it all together, the translation is:

<translation>Kalelealuaka and Keinohoomanawanui, when they arose in the morning and went out of the house, saw a spear standing at the door of the house, it was erected there. Keinohoomanawanui said to Kalelealuaka: "We're going to die! Here is a spear at the door of our house! It is found. We are unlucky in death; I was just about to tell you to leave the chief, there is no exemption from death."</translation>
